TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , who is of NORP origin , was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted an application for the post of deputy county state attorney in the GPE State Attorney ’s Office . He relied on section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW on LAW and section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( ORG vijeće ) , after a secret ballot , unanimously adopted a decision appointing ORG deputy county state attorney in the ORG Attorney ’s Office . It found that both candidates satisfied the statutory requirements to be appointed deputy state attorney but gave priority to ORG , having regard to her extensive experience of working on civil and administrative law cases . The decision contained an information notice ( pouka o pravnom lijeku ) to the effect that administrative dispute proceedings could be instituted against it by bringing an action in ORG ( ORG ) within DATE of its service . The information notice reads as follows :
“ Against this decision an administrative dispute may be instituted by bringing an action in ORG within DATE of the service of the decision . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted administrative dispute proceedings in ORG by bringing an action under section CARDINAL of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) against ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE . He again relied on section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW on LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the applicant ’s action inadmissible , finding that the contested decision did not constitute an “ administrative act ” within the meaning of section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . Therefore , instead of instituting administrative dispute proceedings by bringing an action ( against an administrative act ) , the applicant should have lodged “ a request for the protection of a constitutionally guaranteed right ” ( zahtjev za zaštitu ustavom zajamčenog prava ) , a remedy provided in section CARDINAL of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . ORG also held that the applicant ’s action could not have been , even in substance , regarded as such a request , because he had not relied on any provision of the LAW , but only on LAW on LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint with ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) against ORG decision . In so doing the applicant , alleging a violation of his right of access to court , relied on LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s constitutional complaint . The relevant part of that decision reads as follows :

“ ORG finds that the complainant ’s rights under LAW were not breached in the proceedings before ORG because ORG did not proceed contrary to the legal views established by ORG in the application of that provision to individual cases .

ORG notes that in its practice it has established the rule that there is a remedy before ORG ( a request under LAW of LAW ) against a decision on appointment of a deputy state attorney , and that this remedy has to be used before a constitutional complaint is lodged with ORG ( decision no . U - III-CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE ) . ”

CARDINAL of DATE ) ORG held that in cases where the first - instance courts had wrongly informed parties on legal remedies by indicating longer time - limits for lodging appeals against their decisions than those provided in the relevant legislation , and the parties lodged their appeals outside of the statutory time - limits but within the time - limits indicated by the first - instance courts , those appeals could not be declared inadmissible as lodged out of time . CARDINAL . In its judgment no . Zpa-CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE , following a request for the protection of a constitutionally guaranteed right ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) ORG quashed the decision of ORG on appointment of a municipal court judge . Therefore , by appointing a candidate who did not satisfy the statutory requirements for appointment as a judge of a municipal court , ORG violated the other candidate ’s constitutional right to “ equal access to public service ” guaranteed by LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .

CARDINAL . The Administrative Disputes Act ( Zakon o upravnim sporovima , ORG of ORG no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , and ORG . CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and DATE ) in its relevant part provides as follows :
CARDINAL . Section DATE ) provides that administrative dispute proceedings may be initiated only against an administrative act .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provides that an administrative act , within the meaning of the LAW , is an act whereby a ORG organ , in the exercise of public authority , decides on a right or obligation of an individual or an organisation in an administrative matter .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provides that an administrative act may be challenged for : ( a ) misapplication of substantive law , ( b ) lack of jurisdiction , or ( c ) procedural errors or incorrect findings of fact .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that administrative dispute proceedings are instituted by bringing an action .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provides that the action has to be brought within DATE from the service on the plaintiff of the administrative act ( that is , a decision ) being contested by the action .

CARDINAL . Section ORG ) provides that a statement of claim must contain : ( a ) the first and last name , or the name and the seat , of the plaintiff ; ( b ) the administrative act being contested by the action ; ( c ) a brief statement of the cause of action ; as well as ( d ) to which direction and to what extent it is proposed to quash the administrative act , and ( e ) the signature of the plaintiff . The statement of claim must be accompanied by the original or a copy of the contested act .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provides that if the action is incomplete or incomprehensible , the president of the panel shall invite the plaintiff to rectify the shortcomings within a certain time - limit . In doing so , the president should instruct the plaintiff as to what has to be done and how and warn him or her of the consequences of failing to comply with the court ’s request .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provides that if the plaintiff does not rectify the shortcomings in his action within the time - limit fixed , and they are of such a nature as to prevent the court proceeding with the case , the court shall declare the action inadmissible as deficient .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that ORG must declare an action inadmissible if , inter alia , the contested decision does not constitute an administrative act within the meaning of section CARDINAL of that Act .
CARDINAL . Sections CARDINAL provide for the remedy of reopening of proceedings before ORG and regulate the procedure following a petition for reopening .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that if LAW does not contain specific provisions on the procedure before ORG ( that is , in administrative disputes ) , the provisions of LAW should apply mutatis mutandis .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL reads as follows :

“ A request for the protection of a constitutionally guaranteed right or freedom ... if such a right or freedom has been violated by a final individual act [ that is , a decision ] , and no other judicial protection is ensured , shall be decided by the [ ORG ] , by applying the provisions of this LAW mutatis mutandis . ”

CARDINAL . According to the conclusion reached at the plenary session of judges of ORG held on CARDINAL DATE , an action against an administrative act is to be considered a request for judicial protection within the meaning of LAW of LAW if from the content of the action it transpires that it may concern a breach of rights or freedoms guaranteed by LAW . In such cases ORG could not review every breach of procedural or substantive law but only those that amount to breaches of constitutionally guaranteed rights or freedoms .

CARDINAL . According to ORG case - law ( judgment no . Zpa-CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE ) , the requirements for affording judicial protection under LAW of LAW , which must be met in their totality , are : ( a ) the request has to concern rights or freedoms expressly guaranteed by LAW , ( b ) those rights or freedoms were allegedly breached by a final decision which does not have the characteristics of an administrative act , and ( c ) the legal system does not provide for another judicial avenue of redress . If the request lodged under LAW of LAW does not concern a right or freedom guaranteed by LAW , it should be declared inadmissible ( decision no . Zpa-CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE ) . The time - limit for lodging such a request is the same as the time - limit for bringing an action against an administrative act under LAW of LAW ( see paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL above ) , that is , DATE from the service of the contested decision ( Zpa-CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE ) .

“ ( CARDINAL ) By notice on legal remedies a party is informed whether he or she may lodge an appeal against the decision or institute administrative dispute proceedings or other judicial proceedings .
